discover.instruction: Read the interview. Notice how emphasis is placed on specific information.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай интервью. Обрати внимание, как акцент делается на конкретной информации.

content.text:
Interviewer: So you discovered the cure?
Scientist: Actually, <highlight>it was my colleague who</highlight> discovered it. I just helped.
Interviewer: But you led the research?
Scientist: <highlight>It was the whole team that</highlight> made it possible.
Interviewer: When did the breakthrough happen?
Scientist: <highlight>It was in 2019 that</highlight> we made the key discovery.
Interviewer: What motivated you?
Scientist: <highlight>It was the patients' suffering that</highlight> drove us.
Interviewer: <highlight>What I admire most</highlight> is your humility.
content.question: How do 'It is/was...that/who' structures change the focus of the sentence?
content.question_ru: Как конструкции 'It is/was...that/who' меняют фокус предложения?

theory.title: Cleft Sentences for Focus and Emphasis
theory.title_ru: Эмфатические конструкции для фокуса и выделения

points.rule: It-cleft: It is/was + focused element + that/who + rest
points.rule_ru: It-конструкция: It is/was + выделяемый элемент + that/who + остальное
points.example: It was John who broke the window. (focus on John)
It was Mary who called. It was yesterday that I saw him.

points.rule: What-cleft: What + clause + is/was + focused element
points.rule_ru: What-конструкция: What + придаточное + is/was + выделяемый элемент
points.example: What I need is help. What surprised me was his reaction.
All I want is peace. The reason I'm here is to help.

points.rule: Use to correct information or emphasize contrast
points.rule_ru: Используй для исправления информации или выделения контраста
points.example: A: You broke it. B: No, it was Tom who broke it.

comparison_table.cleft: It was John who broke the window.
It was yesterday that she left.
What annoyed me was his attitude.

notice.instruction: Identify what is being emphasized in each cleft sentence.
notice.instruction_ru: Определи, что выделяется в каждой эмфатической конструкции.

tasks.text:
A discussion about history:

1. It was Columbus who reached America in 1492.
2. Actually, it was the Vikings who arrived first.
3. What many people don't know is that there were already millions of people living there.
4. It was in 1620 that the Pilgrims landed.
5. The thing that changed everything was European colonization.
6. What surprises many is how recent this history is.
7. All we can do now is learn from the past.
8. It's understanding different perspectives that matters most.

find.focus: millions of people were already living there

find.normal: This history is very recent, which surprises many
We can only learn from the past

notice.reflection_question: When do we use it-clefts vs what-clefts?
notice.reflection_question_ru: Когда мы используем it-конструкции vs what-конструкции?

exercises.instruction: Rewrite to emphasize the underlined part using a cleft sentence.

sentences.cleft: It was John who told me the news.
What I need is more time.
It was yesterday that she called.
What caused the problem was his laziness.
It was the noise that woke me up.
All I want is the truth.

sentences.sentence: ___ was my brother ___ broke the vase.
___ I don't understand is why she left.
___ was in Paris ___ they first met.
___ annoys me is his constant complaining.
___ I need is a good night's sleep.
The reason ___ I'm late is the traffic.

sentences.incorrect: It was John which told me.
sentences.correct: It was John who told me.

sentences.incorrect: What I need it is help.
It is yesterday that she called.
sentences.correct: It was yesterday that she called.

produce.instruction: Write a paragraph emphasizing key information using cleft sentences.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши параграф, выделяя ключевую информацию с помощью эмфатических конструкций.
prompts: Correct common misconceptions about a topic
Emphasize what's most important to you
Describe what surprised you about something
Explain the reasons for a decision
produce.example: Many people misunderstand what really happened. It was actually my colleague, not me, who made the discovery. What many don't realize is that we worked on this for years. It was in 2018 that we had our first breakthrough. What drove us was the desire to help patients. All we wanted was to find a cure. The thing that finally worked was a completely new approach. It was teamwork that made it possible. What I've learned is that success is never about one person.
criteria: Uses appropriate relative pronouns (who for people)

texts.title: Myth vs Reality
texts.content: There are many myths about success. It wasn't luck that made them successful - it was hard work. What people don't see is the years of struggle. It was determination that kept them going. All they had was a dream and persistence. What really matters is never giving up. It's consistency, not talent, that makes the difference. The thing that separates winners from losers is attitude. What I've learned is that everyone faces obstacles.

texts.title: Solving the Mystery
texts.content: The detective explained the case. It was the butler who committed the crime. What gave him away was a small detail. It was the footprint that led us to him. All we needed was one piece of evidence. It was in the garden that we found it. The thing that surprised us was his motive. What he wanted was simply revenge. It wasn't money that drove him - it was jealousy.

texts.title: Relationship Advice
texts.content: What makes relationships work? It's communication that's most important. What many couples forget is to listen. It isn't grand gestures that matter - it's small daily acts. All your partner wants is to feel valued. What destroys relationships is taking each other for granted. It's respect that builds trust. The thing that saves most relationships is honest conversation. What I tell my clients is this: it's effort that counts.

texts.title: Learning Languages
texts.content: What many students don't understand is that grammar isn't everything. It's practice that makes perfect. What you need is consistent exposure. It was daily conversation that improved my fluency. All I did was speak every day. The thing that held me back was fear of mistakes. What changed everything was accepting that errors are natural. It isn't talent that matters - it's dedication. What works is finding methods you enjoy.

texts.title: Career Change
texts.content: People ask why I changed careers. What motivated me was a desire for purpose. It was boredom that made me reconsider. All I wanted was to make a difference. It wasn't the salary that attracted me - it was the mission. What surprised my friends was my decision to earn less. The thing that convinced me was meeting people in the field. It was in 2020 that I made the change. What I've gained is happiness.
